Passage: INTRODUCTION

This Guidance is issued under section 15(2) of the Financial Services and Markets Regulations 2015 (“FSMR”). It should be read in conjunction with FSMR, the relevant Rulebooks of the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (“the Regulator”) and the Guidance & Policies Manual of the Regulator.

DefinedTerms.Authority: Means the Securities and Commodities Authority, the Financial Services Regulatory Authority or the Dubai Financial Services Authority.
DefinedTerms.FSMR: Means the Financial Services and Markets Regulations 2015.
DefinedTerms.Guidance: Has the meaning given in section 15(2) of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Regulator: Means the Financial Services Regulatory Authority.

Passage: The Guidance is relevant to an applicant for a Financial Services Permission (“FSP”) to carry on the Regulated Activity of Managing a Collective Investment Fund, as defined in FSRA Fund Rules (“FUNDS”), where the Fund Manager operates a Venture Capital (“VC”) Fund.  This Guidance applies only to Fund Managers of VC Funds (“VC Managers”), not to their management of other types of funds other than VC Funds or additional Regulated Activities that are not related to co-investments by third parties in VC Funds.

NamedEntities.fund manager: The party that sets up the fund, decides the investment strategy, appoints the agents, and is responsible for the promotion and the marketing of the fund. It makes all of the important decisions related to the fund. Also called fund promotor or fund sponsor. This is a dupliucate of Fund Management Company at the moment
NamedEntities.funds: artificial currency used as calculation basis for another currency(s) and accounting purposes

DefinedTerms.Capital: Means Tier 1 Capital, as defined in PRU.
DefinedTerms.Collective Investment Fund: Means an arrangement falling within section 106 of FSMR and which is not excluded under FUNDS Chapter 2.
DefinedTerms.Financial Services Permission: Means a permission given, or having effect as if so given, by the Regulator in accordance with ‎Part 4 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Fund Manager: Means a Person responsible for the management of the property held for or within a Fund and who otherwise operates the Fund.
DefinedTerms.Guidance: Has the meaning given in section 15(2) of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Investment:
Means in relation to:
(a)	COBS, means either of the following:
(i)	a Security; or

(ii)	a Derivative,
unless otherwise specified
(b)	GEN and elsewhere, means Specified Investments set out in Part 3 of Schedule 1 of FSMR, unless otherwise specified.
DefinedTerms.Managing a Collective Investment Fund: Has the meaning given in paragraph 59 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Regulated Activity: Has the meaning given in section 19 of FSMR.

Passage: The Guidance sets out the Regulator’s approach to an application for an FSP to operate under the framework outlined here for VC Managers (the “VC Manager Framework”), in addition to the existing requirements in relation to the Threshold Conditions as set out in the FSMR and the General Rulebook.

DefinedTerms.FSMR: Means the Financial Services and Markets Regulations 2015.
DefinedTerms.Guidance: Has the meaning given in section 15(2) of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Regulator: Means the Financial Services Regulatory Authority.
DefinedTerms.Rulebook: Means the ADGM financial services rulebooks comprising GLO, GEN, PRU, PIN, MIR, AML, MKT, COBS, FUNDS, CIB, IFR and FEES.

Passage: In particular, this Guidance includes the eligibility and authorisation criteria that applicants must satisfy to be authorised as VC Managers, the ongoing regulatory requirements, and the types of restrictions that the Regulator may impose on a VC Manager’s activities.

DefinedTerms.Guidance: Has the meaning given in section 15(2) of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Regulator: Means the Financial Services Regulatory Authority.

Passage: This Guidance is not an exhaustive source of the Regulator’s policy on the exercise of its statutory powers and discretions. In discharging its regulatory mandate, the Regulator may impose other, specific conditions to address any additional risks posed by the proposed activities of the VC Manager.

NamedEntities.policy: system of principles, rules and guidelines, adopted by an organization to guide decision making with respect to particular situations and implemented via procedures or protocols to achieve stated goals

DefinedTerms.Guidance: Has the meaning given in section 15(2) of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Regulator: Means the Financial Services Regulatory Authority.

Passage: The Regulator is not bound by the requirements set out in this Guidance and may modify this Guidance at its discretion where appropriate.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Understand the Nature of Guidance**: Recognize that guidance from the regulator is not legally binding but serves to clarify and interpret the regulatory framework."
Obligation:2 "Acknowledge Regulator's Discretion**: Be aware that the regulator is not bound by the guidance and may modify or interpret it differently as needed."
Obligation:3 "Identify Actual Obligations**: Refer to the underlying rules and regulations to determine your specific legal obligations within the ADGM."
Obligation:4 "Follow the Guidance for Compliance**: Use the guidance to inform your compliance practices and align with the regulator's current approach to enforcement and interpretation."
Obligation:5 "Stay Informed of Changes**: Monitor for updates or changes to the guidance to ensure that your compliance practices remain current and effective."

Obligation:6 "Engage with the Regulator or Professionals**: Seek clarification from the regulator or consult with a compliance professional or legal advisor if there is uncertainty about how the guidance applies to your situation."
Obligation:7 "Be Prepared to Adjust Practices**: Be ready to adapt your compliance practices in response to any changes in the guidance issued by the regulator."

DefinedTerms.Guidance: Has the meaning given in section 15(2) of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Regulator: Means the Financial Services Regulatory Authority.

Passage: Unless otherwise defined or the context otherwise requires, the terms contained in this Guidance have the same meanings as defined in FSMR and the Glossary (“GLO”). Other FSRA Rulebooks referred to in this Guidance are the General Rulebook (“GEN”) and the Prudential – Investment, Insurance Intermediation and Banking Rules (“PRU”).

DefinedTerms.FSMR: Means the Financial Services and Markets Regulations 2015.
DefinedTerms.GEN: Means the General module of the Rulebook.
DefinedTerms.GLO: Means the Glossary module of the Rulebook.
DefinedTerms.Guidance: Has the meaning given in section 15(2) of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Insurance Intermediation: Has the meaning given in paragraph 33 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Investment:
Means in relation to:
(a)	COBS, means either of the following:
(i)	a Security; or

(ii)	a Derivative,
unless otherwise specified
(b)	GEN and elsewhere, means Specified Investments set out in Part 3 of Schedule 1 of FSMR, unless otherwise specified.
DefinedTerms.Rulebook: Means the ADGM financial services rulebooks comprising GLO, GEN, PRU, PIN, MIR, AML, MKT, COBS, FUNDS, CIB, IFR and FEES.

Passage: OBJECTIVES OF THE VC MANAGER FRAMEWORK

VC Funds are investment funds that seek private equity stakes in start-ups or young, small or medium enterprises (whether companies or partnerships, collectively “Early Stage entities”) which typically offer products that are innovative and possess strong growth potential, such as those at the cutting-edge of technology.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Obtain Necessary Licenses**: Apply for and secure the appropriate licenses from the FSRA to legally operate within ADGM."
Obligation:2 "Ensure Proper Fund Structure**: Establish the VC Fund in compliance with ADGM regulations, choosing the correct legal entity and fund classification."

Obligation:3 "Maintain Transparency and Disclosure**: Provide clear, accurate, and regular information to investors and the regulator about the fund's strategy, risks, fees, expenses, and performance."
Obligation:4 "Adhere to AML/CFT Regulations**: Implement systems and controls to prevent money laundering and terrorist financing, conduct customer due diligence, and report suspicious activities."

Obligation:5 "Implement Fit and Proper Management**: Ensure that senior management and control functions are carried out by individuals who meet the integrity, competence, and financial soundness standards."
Obligation:6 "Establish Robust Risk Management**: Identify, manage, and monitor risks associated with the fund's investment activities through effective risk management systems."
Obligation:7 "Conduct Proper Valuation and Pricing**: Develop and maintain valuation policies and procedures for consistent asset valuation."
Obligation:8 "Manage Conflicts of Interest**: Identify and manage any potential conflicts of interest to prevent adverse effects on the fund's operation and investor interests."
Obligation:9 "Protect Investors**: Act in the best interests of investors, ensure fair treatment, and provide access to redress mechanisms for disputes."

Obligation:10 "Perform Regular Audits and Reporting**: Have financial statements audited annually by an independent auditor, and submit regular reports to the FSRA on compliance and other regulatory matters."
Obligation:11 "Comply with Ongoing Supervision**: Cooperate with the FSRA's ongoing supervision, which may include periodic inspections and reviews."
Obligation:12 "Follow Marketing Regulations**: Ensure that all marketing and promotional materials are clear, fair, and not misleading, and comply with restrictions on marketing to retail clients."
Obligation:13 "Maintain Good Governance**: Set up proper governance structures, such as a board of directors or general partner, with the necessary expertise and independence."
Obligation:14 "Adhere to Legal Structure Requirements**: Comply with ADGM's requirements for legal structures, such as setting up as a Limited Partnership if applicable."

Obligation:15 "Ensure Compliance with Fund Operation Rules**: Follow ADGM rules regarding fund operation, including asset custody and handling conflicts of interest.

Please note that these action items are based on a general overview and the specific obligations may vary. It is crucial to consult the relevant ADGM regulations or seek legal advice for precise regulatory responsibilities."

NamedEntities.funds: artificial currency used as calculation basis for another currency(s) and accounting purposes

Passage: VC Managers typically raise funds for a VC Fund from sophisticated and financially well-resourced investors, and invest those funds into Early Stage entities.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Obtain the necessary **licensing and authorization** from the FSRA to operate as a VC Manager."
Obligation:2 "Ensure that the VC Manager and key personnel meet the **fit and proper criteria** set by the FSRA."
Obligation:3 "Maintain a certain level of **regulatory capital** as required by the FSRA."
Obligation:4 "Implement measures to **protect investors**, including clear disclosure of investment strategies, risks, fees, and expenses."
Obligation:5 "Conduct thorough **due diligence** on potential investments to assess viability and risks."
Obligation:6 "Adhere to **AML/CFT regulations** by establishing systems to prevent money laundering and terrorist financing."
Obligation:7 "Establish and maintain an effective **risk management framework**."
Obligation:8 "Comply with **periodic reporting obligations** to the FSRA and, where applicable, to investors."
Obligation:9 "Identify, manage, and disclose any **conflicts of interest**."
Obligation:10 "Ensure that all **marketing materials and promotions** are fair, clear, and not misleading."
Obligation:11 "Maintain good **corporate governance** practices."
Obligation:12 "Implement strong **operational controls** for proper fund administration."
Obligation:13 "Monitor ongoing compliance with all regulatory requirements and adapt to any **changes in legislation or regulations**."
Obligation:14 "Ensure that the VC Fund's assets are **fairly and accurately valued**, and that unit pricing complies with the fund's valuation policy."
Obligation:15 "Arrange for **custody of assets** with a third-party custodian."
Obligation:16 "Ensure the VC Fund is **audited annually** by an independent auditor approved by the FSRA."
Obligation:17 "Maintain **comprehensive records** of all business activities for the period specified by the FSRA."

Obligation:18 "If ceasing operations, comply with the FSRA's requirements for an **orderly wind-down** of activities.

Please note that this consolidated list is based on general information and it is essential to consult the FSRA's rules or seek legal advice for specific regulatory requirements applicable to your VC Fund in ADGM."

Passage: VC Funds can play an important role in Abu Dhabi and the wider UAE in nurturing start-up ecosystems by providing funding and mentorship to Early Stage entities seeking to launch and grow their businesses.  As such, there are economic and other benefits for a tailored regulatory regime to anchor the activities of VC Managers in Abu Dhabi.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Obtain Registration and Licensing**: Apply for and secure the necessary licenses from the FSRA to operate as a VC Manager within ADGM."

Obligation:2 "Pass Fit and Proper Test**: Ensure that all individuals involved in the management of the VC Fund meet the FSRA's 'fit and proper' criteria, including integrity, competence, and financial soundness."
Obligation:3 "Meet Capital Requirements**: Maintain any minimum capital requirements as specified by the FSRA for VC Managers."

Obligation:4 "Ensure Disclosure and Transparency**: Provide clear, accurate, and regular information to investors and the FSRA about the VC Fund's activities, risks, investment strategy, and performance."

Obligation:5 "Comply with AML/CFT Regulations**: Adhere to AML/CFT requirements by conducting due diligence on investors, keeping records, monitoring transactions, and reporting suspicious activities."
Obligation:6 "Adhere to Conduct of Business Rules**: Follow the FSRA's COBS rules, ensuring fair client dealings, managing conflicts of interest, and ensuring investment suitability."
Obligation:7 "Manage the Fund Responsibly**: Operate the VC Fund in accordance with its offering documents and ADGM regulations, including asset custody and investor relations."
Obligation:8 "Establish Governance and Internal Controls**: Implement effective governance structures and internal controls for prudent VC Fund management."
Obligation:9 "Implement Risk Management**: Develop and maintain a risk management framework to identify and manage the risks associated with the VC Fund's activities."
Obligation:10 "Maintain Professional Indemnity Insurance**: Hold professional indemnity insurance if required based on the nature of VC management activities."
Obligation:11 "Submit Reporting Obligations**: Provide the FSRA with regular reports on the VC Fund's operations, including financial statements and regulatory compliance."
Obligation:12 "Conduct Business with Integrity**: Operate in a manner that aligns with the best interests of investors and market integrity."
Obligation:13 "Practice Sound Corporate Governance**: Establish a board of directors with the necessary expertise and independence, and maintain sound corporate governance practices."

Obligation:14 "Protect Investor Interests**: Take reasonable steps to ensure the fair treatment of investors and avoid conflicts of interest.

*Note*: These action items are based on the provided responses and should be cross-referenced with the latest FSRA regulations and guidelines. It is advisable to consult with a compliance professional or legal advisor for detailed obligations."

NamedEntities.funds: artificial currency used as calculation basis for another currency(s) and accounting purposes

Passage: VC Funds exhibit the following characteristics that result in them presenting a different structure and risk profile compared to non-VC Funds.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Obtain Registration and Licensing**: Ensure the VC Fund and its managers are properly registered and licensed with the FSRA, including obtaining a Financial Services Permission (FSP) if necessary."

Obligation:2 "Ensure Proper Fund Structure and Documentation**: Structure the VC Fund in compliance with ADGM regulations and prepare all necessary documentation, such as offering documents, subscription agreements, and constitutional documents, according to regulatory standards."

Obligation:3 "Provide Disclosure and Transparency**: Offer clear, accurate, and complete information to investors about the fund's investment strategy, risks, fees, expenses, and regular performance reports."
Obligation:4 "Comply with FSRA Rules and Regulations**: Adhere to all relevant FSRA rules, including the Fund Rules (FUNDS), Conduct of Business Rulebook (COBS), and AML/CFT requirements."
Obligation:5 "Implement Risk Management Systems**: Establish and maintain appropriate risk management systems to manage the specific risks associated with VC investing."
Obligation:6 "Conduct Due Diligence**: Perform thorough due diligence on investments to ensure they align with the fund's criteria and serve the best interests of the investors."
Obligation:7 "Manage Conflicts of Interest**: Identify, manage, and disclose any potential conflicts of interest."
Obligation:8 "Fulfill Reporting Requirements**: Regularly report to the FSRA, providing financial statements and any other required information."
Obligation:9 "Protect Investors**: Act in the best interests of the investors, treat them fairly, and implement measures to manage conflicts of interest."
Obligation:10 "Maintain Corporate Governance**: Uphold good corporate governance practices, including a competent board, clear organizational structure, and effective oversight mechanisms."
Obligation:11 "Ensure Proper Valuation Procedures**: Establish appropriate valuation procedures for the assets held by the VC Fund."
Obligation:12 "Adhere to Marketing Regulations**: Market the VC Fund in accordance with ADGM regulations, ensuring all marketing materials are not misleading."
Obligation:13 "Meet Capital Requirements**: Comply with any applicable capital requirements, which may be lower for VC Fund Managers compared to other fund managers."
Obligation:14 "Maintain Operational Controls**: Keep adequate internal controls and systems for proper fund management, including asset segregation, valuation procedures, and custody arrangements."
Obligation:15 "Hold Professional Indemnity Insurance**: Maintain professional indemnity insurance as required to cover potential liabilities."

Obligation:16 "Comply with Ongoing Obligations**: Adhere to ongoing regulatory reporting and notification requirements set by the FSRA.

Please note that these action items are based on a general overview and should be tailored to the specific circumstances of the VC Fund and its managers. For detailed obligations, consult the relevant ADGM regulations or seek advice from a compliance professional or legal advisor."

NamedEntities.funds: artificial currency used as calculation basis for another currency(s) and accounting purposes

Passage: Risk profile.	VC Funds typically invest in small, minority equity positions in small ventures that are not traded on public markets.  They typically utilize little or no leverage when acquiring their investments, which tend to be far smaller than investments made by private equity funds.  VC Funds are also closed-ended, and do not in practice permit investors to make ongoing subscriptions or redemptions at their discretion once the funds have completed the subscription period , thereby reducing liquidity risk.  As such, VC Managers and the VC Funds they manage generally pose lower systemic and contagion risks, and should therefore give rise to fewer market impact concerns in the event of their failure.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Regulatory Compliance**: Ensure adherence to ADGM regulations and FSRA rules, including AML and CTF requirements."
Obligation:2 "Fund Registration and Structuring**: Register the VC Fund with the FSRA and structure it according to ADGM's legal framework, ensuring it is set up as a closed-ended fund."

Obligation:3 "Risk Management**: Establish and maintain risk management systems to manage VC investment risks, such as liquidity risk, concentration risk, and risks associated with minority equity positions."

Obligation:4 "Investor Protection and Suitability**: Provide clear information to investors about the fund's strategy, risks, fees, and conflicts of interest, and ensure that the fund is marketed to suitable investors who understand the risks."

Obligation:5 "Reporting Obligations**: Submit regular reports to the FSRA and investors on the fund's financial health, risk profile, performance, and any significant operational or strategic changes."
Obligation:6 "Corporate Governance**: Maintain high standards of governance with an effective board of directors, clear organizational structure, and oversight mechanisms."
Obligation:7 "Market Conduct**: Act with integrity and in the best interests of investors, avoiding market abuse and maintaining market confidence."
Obligation:8 "Disclosure and Transparency**: Provide adequate disclosure to investors and the FSRA regarding the fund's financial condition, investment performance, and material risks."
Obligation:9 "Prudential Requirements**: Comply with any applicable prudential requirements, including capital adequacy and liquidity requirements."
Obligation:10 "Valuation**: Implement robust valuation procedures for investments in small, non-public ventures."
Obligation:11 "Exit Strategies**: Develop and disclose clear exit strategies for investments, considering the closed-ended nature of the fund."

Obligation:12 "Operational Resilience**: Ensure operational resilience to manage the fund effectively and minimize market impact in the event of failure.

It is important for VC Fund Managers to consult the FSRA's rules and guidance or seek professional legal advice to ensure full compliance with all regulatory requirements within ADGM."

NamedEntities.liquidity: Precise definition needed for liquidity, and check that it is modeled accordingly.
NamedEntities.funds: artificial currency used as calculation basis for another currency(s) and accounting purposes

Passage: Clients.	As investments in VC Funds are risky in nature, investors in VC Funds are Professional Clients which possess higher levels of financial sophistication and financial resources. VC Fund investors anticipate that many of the Early Stage entities the VC Fund invests in will fail: however, they also expect that at least a few investments will generate significant returns and make the entire fund profitable overall.  In addition, VC Managers typically invest their own financial resources in the VC Fund alongside their investors, as they earn money primarily from their own investments rather than management / advisory fees.  This common exposure to the risks of each investment by the VC Fund ensures that a VC Manager has its interests aligned with those of its investors .  Therefore, VC Managers should generally present fewer concerns in relation to investor protection and conduct risks arising from any potential for conflicts of interest.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Client Classification**: Verify that all investors in the VC Fund are correctly classified as Professional Clients, conducting due diligence to confirm their financial sophistication and resources."
Obligation:2 "Disclosure**: Clearly communicate to investors the risks associated with VC investments, including the potential for both failure and significant returns."
Obligation:3 "Conflict of Interest**: Establish and maintain policies and procedures to manage, monitor, and disclose conflicts of interest, ensuring transparency and fairness."
Obligation:4 "Due Diligence**: Perform thorough due diligence on potential investments to ensure they align with the fund's strategy and investor risk tolerance."

Obligation:5 "Regulatory Compliance**: Adhere to all ADGM regulations, including AML, CFT, and other financial regulations, and ensure all necessary regulatory filings and notifications are completed."
Obligation:6 "Reporting and Transparency**: Provide transparent reporting on the VC Fund's performance, investment value, and any material changes to operations or strategy."
Obligation:7 "Risk Management**: Implement robust risk management practices to address market, liquidity, and operational risks."
Obligation:8 "Alignment of Interests**: Invest personal financial resources in the VC Fund and structure compensation to prioritize fund success over fees."
Obligation:9 "Ongoing Monitoring**: Continuously monitor investments and the market to make informed decisions for the benefit of investors."
Obligation:10 "Professional Conduct**: Uphold professionalism, integrity, and ethical conduct in all interactions with investors and stakeholders."
Obligation:11 "Fiduciary Duty**: Act in the best interests of the investors, exercising due diligence and professional care."
Obligation:12 "Training and Competence**: Ensure all staff are adequately trained, competent, and aware of their regulatory obligations and the risks associated with VC investments."
Obligation:13 "Policy Review and Update**: Regularly review and update policies and procedures to remain compliant with regulatory changes and the evolving nature of the VC Fund's activities."

NamedEntities.interest: the cost of using credit, or another's money, expressed as a rate per period of time, payable by a debtor to a creditor in consideration of the credit extended to the debtor
NamedEntities.exposure: the extent to which an individual or organization is unprotected and open to damage, danger, risk of suffering a loss, or uncertainty

Passage: Regulatory Capital.	Unlike traditional Fund Managers, the capital of VC Managers is largely invested in Early Stage entities.  As a VC Manager does not necessarily operate on steady streams of revenue earned from management / advisory fees, the ongoing financial health of the VC Manager is very much dependent on the valuation of its illiquid investments which can only be realized on divestment. Consequently, it may not be meaningful to impose the standard capital requirements on a VC Manager, as long as it has the ability to meet its liabilities as they fall due.  In addition, given that most successful VC Managers are serial entrepreneurs who have accumulated their financial resources through successful exits, the track record and experience of the principal(s) in a VC Manager is equally important in assessing the ongoing viability of that VC Manager than is the case for traditional fund managers.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Liquidity Management**: Maintain adequate liquidity to meet liabilities as they fall due, ensuring operational continuity."
Obligation:2 "Financial Resources**: Sustain sufficient financial resources to cover potential risks, liabilities, and support business operations."
Obligation:3 "Valuation and Reporting**: Regularly assess and accurately report the valuation of illiquid investments to determine the financial health of the VC firm."

Obligation:4 "Risk Management**: Implement and maintain robust risk management practices for risks associated with investing in Early Stage entities, including market, liquidity, and counterparty risks."

Obligation:5 "Disclosure and Transparency**: Clearly disclose to investors the risks associated with VC investments and the financial condition of the firm, including the illiquid nature of investments."
Obligation:6 "Compliance with Regulations**: Adhere to all relevant ADGM regulations and guidelines, including AML, KYC, and other financial services regulations."
Obligation:7 "Track Record and Experience**: Maintain and demonstrate a track record and experience in managing VC investments to assess the firm's viability."

Obligation:8 "Regulatory Filings and Notifications**: Stay current with required filings, notifications, and disclosures as mandated by the ADGM FSRA, including changes in financial situation or operational capabilities."
Obligation:9 "Professional Indindemnity Insurance**: Obtain or consider obtaining professional indemnity insurance to cover potential liabilities."
Obligation:10 "Ongoing Monitoring**: Continuously monitor compliance with obligations and adapt to changes in the regulatory environment that may affect operations."

Obligation:11 "Capital Adequacy**: Ensure adequate capital is maintained that is appropriate for the nature, scale, and complexity of the business, including a process for ongoing assessment of capital adequacy.

It is advisable for VC Managers to consult specific ADGM regulations and guidelines or seek legal advice to ensure full compliance with all regulatory expectations."

NamedEntities.principal: with respect to a debt: the value of an obligation, such as a bond or loan, raised and that must be repaid at maturity; for investments: the original amount of money invested, separate from any associated interest, dividends or capital gains

DefinedTerms.Capital: Means Tier 1 Capital, as defined in PRU.

Passage: Governance and controls.	The nature of VC Fund investments is such that traditional internal governance and control structures may not be appropriate or relevant for a VC Manager.  Traditional fund managers are typically required to have an independent valuation function for the fund. As most early-stage fund investments may not be generating revenues or may not yet be profitable, the investment decisions of a VC Manager hinge very much on the qualitative assessment and expert judgment of the individual manager, rather than conventional financial models.  Valuation of early-stage investments is typically subjective, and is to a large extent determined by investor appetite during the actual funding rounds of the Early Stage entities. As periodic valuation of a VC Fund’s assets based upon traditional cash flow or balance sheet models cannot take into consideration the unique, speculative nature of the fund’s investments, the benefit  of imposing conventional control structures on a VC Manager is generally not proportionate compared to the cost of doing so.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Implement Tailored Governance and Control Structures**: Develop and maintain governance and internal control structures that are flexible and appropriate for the nature of VC investments, considering the qualitative assessment and expert judgment required."

Obligation:2 "Establish Valuation Practices**: Create a valuation policy that takes into account the subjective nature of valuing early-stage investments, using expert judgment and relevant market indicators."

Obligation:3 "Perform Periodic Valuation**: Conduct regular valuations of the VC Fund’s assets, ensuring that the process captures the speculative nature of the investments and is communicated to investors."

Obligation:4 "Disclose Valuation Methodologies to Investors**: Clearly explain to investors the methodologies and inherent uncertainties in valuing early-stage investments, including the speculative nature and reliance on qualitative assessments."

Obligation:5 "Ensure Regulatory Compliance**: Adhere to all relevant ADGM regulations, including those tailored for VC Managers, and maintain compliance with rules around risk management, conflict of interest, and investor protection."

Obligation:6 "Maintain Documentation and Record Keeping**: Keep thorough records of governance policies, valuation procedures, investment decisions, and risk management practices for transparency and regulatory review."

Obligation:7 "Apply the Proportionality Principle**: Balance the implementation of control structures against their costs, ensuring they are proportionate to the nature and scale of the VC Fund’s operations."
Obligation:8 "Implement Appropriate Risk Management**: Develop a risk management framework that reflects the high-risk nature of early-stage investments."
Obligation:9 "Maintain Transparency with Regulators**: Be open with ADGM regulators about governance, risk management, and control practices, and be prepared to justify the chosen approach."

Obligation:10 "Regularly Review and Adapt Practices**: Continuously evaluate and update governance and control practices to align with the VC Fund’s investment strategy and changes in the regulatory environment.

It is crucial to consult the ADGM's Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) rules and guidance or seek professional legal advice to ensure full compliance with all obligations."

NamedEntities.balance: amount of money available or owed
NamedEntities.control: situation in which some party has the power to direct or strongly influence the direction of the management and policies related to something

Passage: Co-investments. A “co-investment” is an investment that is made alongside, but not as part of, a Fund’s investment into a target company. Generally speaking, a VC Fund Manager typically seeks co-investments where to do so would, for example, allow a Fund to participate in an offered private equity stake in a target entity that it would otherwise not qualify for or to assist an investee company to increase its committed capital raise.  The Regulator is of the view that a VC Manager may, in the course of is business, seek to arrange co-investments and offer advice to co-investors.  In order to do so, a VC Manager will also need a Financial Services Permission to carry out one or both of the additional activities of Regulated Activities of “Advising on Investments or Credit” and “Arranging Deals in Investments”. A VC Manager may apply for a Financial Services Permission including one or both of those Regulated Activities and remain within the scope of the VC Framework, provided that the additional Regulated Activities are limited to activities necessary to bring about co-investments in an investee company of a VC Fund which the VC Manager manages.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Obtain or Extend Financial Services Permission (FSP):**
   - Apply for and obtain the appropriate FSP from the ADGM FSRA to conduct "Advising on Investments or Credit" and "Arranging Deals in Investments" if not already permitted.
   - If necessary, apply for an extension of your existing FSP to include these additional Regulated Activities."

Obligation:2 "Limit Scope of Activities:**
   - Ensure that the additional Regulated Activities are limited to facilitating co-investments in investee companies of VC Funds you manage."

Obligation:3 "Compliance with VC Framework and Regulatory Requirements:**
   - Adhere to the VC Framework established by the ADGM and comply with all relevant regulatory requirements, including conduct and disclosure obligations."

Obligation:4 "Disclosure and Transparency:**
   - Provide clear information to potential co-investors about the nature of the co-investment, the relationship with the VC Fund, and any associated risks."

Obligation:5 "Conflict of Interest Management:**
   - Implement and maintain robust policies and procedures to identify, manage, and disclose any conflicts of interest."

Obligation:6 "Due Diligence:**
   - Conduct appropriate due diligence on co-investment opportunities to ensure they are suitable for co-investors and align with the VC Fund's investment strategy."

Obligation:7 "Record-Keeping and Documentation:**
   - Maintain accurate and comprehensive records of all co-investment activities, advice given, and arrangements made."

Obligation:8 "Reporting Obligations:**
   - Monitor co-investment activities and report any significant changes or events to the FSRA as required."

Obligation:9 "Professional Indemnity Insurance:**
   - Ensure adequate professional indemnity insurance coverage is in place for the additional Regulated Activities."

Obligation:10 "Consultation and Legal Advice:**
    - Consult the relevant ADGM regulations and seek legal advice if necessary to ensure full compliance with all regulatory requirements.

By following these consolidated action items, a VC Fund Manager in the ADGM will be able to manage co-investment activities while remaining compliant with the regulatory framework."

NamedEntities.fund manager: The party that sets up the fund, decides the investment strategy, appoints the agents, and is responsible for the promotion and the marketing of the fund. It makes all of the important decisions related to the fund. Also called fund promotor or fund sponsor. This is a dupliucate of Fund Management Company at the moment

DefinedTerms.Advising on Investments or Credit: Has the meaning given in paragraph 28 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Arranging Deals in Investments: Has the meaning given in paragraph 16 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Credit: Includes any cash loan or other financial accommodation.
DefinedTerms.Financial Services Permission: Means a permission given, or having effect as if so given, by the Regulator in accordance with ‎Part 4 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Fund Manager: Means a Person responsible for the management of the property held for or within a Fund and who otherwise operates the Fund.
DefinedTerms.Regulator: Means the Financial Services Regulatory Authority.

Passage: In light of these considerations, the Regulator has created a proportionate, risk-based regulatory framework for VC Managers that streamlines their regulatory requirements, while applying the necessary regulatory safeguards to ensure they operate in a safe and sound manner. The authorisation criteria and ongoing regulatory requirements under this framework are set out in the next section.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Obtain the necessary license from the ADGM Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) to operate as a VC Manager."
Obligation:2 "Meet the 'fit and proper' criteria set by the FSRA, assessing integrity, competence, financial soundness, and other relevant factors."
Obligation:3 "Maintain minimum capital requirements as specified by the FSRA."
Obligation:4 "Implement appropriate risk management systems to identify, manage, and monitor risks."
Obligation:5 "Establish and maintain effective compliance arrangements, including policies and procedures."
Obligation:6 "Submit regular reports to the FSRA on financial statements, risk management, and investor-related information."
Obligation:7 "Provide clear and accurate information to investors about investment strategy, risks, fees, and expenses."
Obligation:8 "Identify, manage, and disclose any conflicts of interest."
Obligation:9 "Implement measures to protect the interests of investors, including custody arrangements, valuation policies, and investor redress mechanisms."

Obligation:10 "Comply with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Counter-Terrorist Financing (CTF) regulations, including customer due diligence, transaction monitoring, and reporting suspicious activities."
Obligation:11 "Adhere to market conduct rules to prevent market abuse and ensure fair and transparent operations."
Obligation:12 "Maintain adequate professional indemnity insurance to cover potential liabilities."

Obligation:13 "Ensure a robust corporate governance framework for effective oversight of the VC management business.

These action items are based on common regulatory practices and should be cross-referenced with the specific regulatory text provided by the ADGM FSRA. It is recommended to consult with a compliance professional or legal advisor for precise obligations."

DefinedTerms.Regulator: Means the Financial Services Regulatory Authority.

Passage: AUTHORISATION AND ONGOING REQUIREMENTS

Eligibility Criteria. In order to qualify for authorisation under the VC Manager Framework, an applicant will need to demonstrate that each VC Fund it manages satisfies a number of criteria as set out under FUNDS 4.1.6. These criteria limit a VC Fund to being a closed fund that can invest only in the Securities of non listed companies in an early stage of development, where those Securities are not listed or admitted to trading on an exchange, and it is only available to Professional Clients. Additionally, the maximum subscription cannot exceed USD 100 million or a higher amount approved by the FSRA. While normally the fund will be a Domestic (Exempt or Qualified Investor) Fund, Domestic Feeder and Foreign Funds are allowed subject to FSRA approval .
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Closed Fund Structure**: Ensure that each VC Fund managed is a closed fund, prohibiting investors from redeeming or withdrawing their investments before the end of the fund's term."
Obligation:2 "Investment Focus**: Verify that VC Funds invest exclusively in securities of non-listed, early-stage companies, ensuring these companies are not publicly traded on any exchange."
Obligation:3 "Investor Eligibility**: Confirm that only Professional Clients can invest in the VC Funds, implementing processes to assess and verify investor status according to ADGM regulations."

Obligation:4 "Investment Cap**: Adhere to the maximum subscription limit of USD 100 million per investor, unless a higher amount is approved by the FSRA, and monitor the total capital raised to ensure compliance."

Obligation:5 "Fund Types and Approvals**: Manage Domestic Funds (Exempt or Qualified Investor Funds), Domestic Feeder, and Foreign Funds, obtaining necessary approvals from the FSRA for managing non-standard fund types or exceeding subscription limits."
Obligation:6 "Regulatory Compliance**: Maintain ongoing compliance with all ADGM regulations, including governance, reporting, conduct of business rules, and any other applicable requirements."
Obligation:7 "Record-Keeping and Reporting**: Keep accurate records of all VC Fund management activities and report necessary information to the FSRA as required by the regulatory framework."
Obligation:8 "Risk Management**: Implement and maintain robust risk management policies and procedures to address investment, operational, and compliance risks."

Obligation:9 "Due Diligence**: Conduct thorough due diligence on potential investments to ensure they meet the criteria of being non-listed, early-stage companies.

By adhering to these consolidated action items, you will fulfill your obligations under the ADGM's VC Manager Framework and ensure compliance with the FUNDS 4.1.6 regulations."

NamedEntities.funds: artificial currency used as calculation basis for another currency(s) and accounting purposes
NamedEntities.exchange: any organization, association, or group of persons, whether incorporated or unincorporated, which constitutes, maintains, or provides a facility for bringing together purchasers and sellers of financial instruments, commodities, or other products, services, or goods, and includes the market place and facilities maintained by such exchange

Passage:
Financial Services Permissions. VC Managers operating in ADGM require a Financial Services Permission (“FSP”) to undertake any Regulated Activity pertaining to VC Funds and/or co-investments by third parties in VC Funds. The Regulated Activities covered by the FSP will be dependent on the VC Managers’ investment strategy and business model.
(a)	Managing a Collective Investment Fund: this includes carrying out fund management activities in respect of a VC Fund.
(b)	Advising on Investments or Credit : for VC Managers these activities will be restricted to activities related to co-investment alongside a VC Fund which the VC Manager manages, such as recommending that a client invest in an investee company alongside the VC Fund and on the strategy and structure required to make the investment.
(c)	Arranging Deals in Investments: VC Managers may also wish to make arrangements to facilitate co-investments in the investee company.
Authorisation fees and supervision fees for a VC Manager are capped at USD 10,000 regardless of whether one or both of the additional Regulated Activities in b) and c) above in relation to co-investments are included in its FSP. The FSP will include restrictions appropriate to the business model of a VC Manager.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Obtain Financial Services Permission (FSP):**
   - Apply for and obtain an FSP from the FSRA before conducting any Regulated Activities related to VC Funds or co-investments."

Obligation:2 "Conduct Regulated Activities as Authorized:**
   - Manage a Collective Investment Fund, including making investment decisions and managing assets.
   - Advise on investments or credit, specifically for co-investments alongside a VC Fund.
   - Arrange deals in investments to facilitate co-investments in the investee company."

Obligation:3 "Comply with Fees:**
   - Pay the required authorisation and supervision fees, capped at USD 10,000, regardless of the number of Regulated Activities conducted."

Obligation:4 "Adhere to Business Model Restrictions:**
   - Operate within the restrictions outlined in the FSP that are tailored to the VC Manager's business model."

Obligation:5 "Maintain Compliance with Ongoing Regulatory Requirements:**
   - Implement policies and procedures for compliance with ADGM regulations, including AML, CTF, and financial crime prevention measures.
   - Keep accurate and complete records of all business activities and transactions.
   - Maintain adequate financial resources and conduct business with integrity."

Obligation:6 "Risk Management and Internal Controls:**
   - Establish and maintain adequate risk management processes and internal controls."

Obligation:7 "Governance and Oversight:**
   - Ensure proper governance structures, including a competent management team and, if applicable, an independent board of directors."

Obligation:8 "Client and Investor Protection:**
   - Implement measures to protect clients' interests, including clear communication of investment risks and transparent reporting.
   - Act in the best interests of investors and provide clear and fair information about investments, risks, fees, or charges."

Obligation:9 "Reporting and Disclosure:**
   - Submit regular reports to the FSRA, including financial statements and any other required disclosures."

Obligation:10 "Stay Updated and Seek Advice:**
   - Regularly review the ADGM's regulatory framework and any changes in the regulatory environment.
   - Seek professional legal or compliance advice if uncertain about any obligations.

By following these consolidated action items, a VC Manager in ADGM will ensure compliance with the FSRA regulations."

NamedEntities.investment strategy: plan, method, or series of maneuvers or stratagems for obtaining a specific investment goal
NamedEntities.funds: artificial currency used as calculation basis for another currency(s) and accounting purposes

DefinedTerms.ADGM: Means the Abu Dhabi Global Market.
DefinedTerms.Advising on Investments or Credit: Has the meaning given in paragraph 28 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Arranging Deals in Investments: Has the meaning given in paragraph 16 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Collective Investment Fund: Means an arrangement falling within section 106 of FSMR and which is not excluded under FUNDS Chapter 2.
DefinedTerms.Credit: Includes any cash loan or other financial accommodation.
DefinedTerms.Financial Services Permission: Means a permission given, or having effect as if so given, by the Regulator in accordance with ‎Part 4 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Investment:
Means in relation to:
(a)	COBS, means either of the following:
(i)	a Security; or

(ii)	a Derivative,
unless otherwise specified
(b)	GEN and elsewhere, means Specified Investments set out in Part 3 of Schedule 1 of FSMR, unless otherwise specified.
DefinedTerms.Managing a Collective Investment Fund: Has the meaning given in paragraph 59 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Regulated Activity: Has the meaning given in section 19 of FSMR.

Passage: Financial Services Permissions. A VC Manager holding an FSP to carry on the Regulated Activity of Managing a Collective Investment Fund will not require separate permission for Advising on Investments or Credit and/or Arranging Deals in Investments if it only undertakes those Regulated Activities incidentally, as an ancillary part of its fund management activities. The Regulator considers that this will only apply in limited circumstances and may include, for example, situations when a Fund Manager deals with an existing Fund investor to secure a co-investment from that investor, where the Fund Manager receives no payment for such activity.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Comply with ADGM Regulations**: Ensure all activities, including Managing a Collective Investment Fund and any incidental activities, comply with ADGM regulations and the terms of your FSP."

Obligation:2 "Engage in Permissible Incidental Activities**: You may advise on investments or credit and/or arrange deals in investments without separate permissions, provided these are incidental to your main fund management activities."
Obligation:3 "Assess Scope of Incidental Activities**: Confirm that incidental activities are limited, directly related to fund management, and not a regular feature of your business."
Obligation:4 "Avoid Separate Payment for Incidental Activities**: Do not receive separate payment for incidental activities to avoid them being classified as separate regulated activities."
Obligation:5 "Seek Clarification and Approval When Needed**: Contact the FSRA for guidance if you are unsure about the permissibility of certain incidental activities and seek approval if necessary."
Obligation:6 "Maintain Documentation and Records**: Keep detailed records of all activities, including incidental ones, to demonstrate regulatory compliance and facilitate audits or reviews."
Obligation:7 "Notify the Regulator**: Inform the FSRA of any incidental activities you engage in, if required."
Obligation:8 "Implement Risk Management for Incidental Activities**: Ensure that your risk management processes cover the risks associated with incidental activities."

Obligation:9 "Consult Regulatory Framework or Professional Advice**: Regularly consult the full regulatory framework or seek professional advice to fully understand and stay updated on your obligations."
Obligation:10 "Reassess Permissions as Business Evolves**: Reevaluate your permissions and obligations if your business activities evolve or change in nature."

NamedEntities.fund manager: The party that sets up the fund, decides the investment strategy, appoints the agents, and is responsible for the promotion and the marketing of the fund. It makes all of the important decisions related to the fund. Also called fund promotor or fund sponsor. This is a dupliucate of Fund Management Company at the moment
NamedEntities.holding: real or personal property (assets), including but not limited to financial assets, to which one holds title and of which one has possession

DefinedTerms.Advising on Investments or Credit: Has the meaning given in paragraph 28 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Arranging Deals in Investments: Has the meaning given in paragraph 16 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Collective Investment Fund: Means an arrangement falling within section 106 of FSMR and which is not excluded under FUNDS Chapter 2.
DefinedTerms.Credit: Includes any cash loan or other financial accommodation.
DefinedTerms.Fund Manager: Means a Person responsible for the management of the property held for or within a Fund and who otherwise operates the Fund.
DefinedTerms.Investment:
Means in relation to:
(a)	COBS, means either of the following:
(i)	a Security; or

(ii)	a Derivative,
unless otherwise specified
(b)	GEN and elsewhere, means Specified Investments set out in Part 3 of Schedule 1 of FSMR, unless otherwise specified.
DefinedTerms.Managing a Collective Investment Fund: Has the meaning given in paragraph 59 of Schedule 1 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Regulated Activity: Has the meaning given in section 19 of FSMR.
DefinedTerms.Regulator: Means the Financial Services Regulatory Authority.

Passage: Authorisation. When applying for an FSP the VC Manager will be subject to the following, streamlined evaluation criteria, bearing in mind the considerations set out in section 2 of this Guidance.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Fit and Proper Criteria**: Demonstrate that all relevant individuals (senior management, controlling shareholders, and those undertaking controlled functions) are fit and proper according to FSRA standards."
Obligation:2 "Business Plan**: Submit a comprehensive business plan detailing strategy, target market, investment approach, risk management, operational structure, and how client needs will be met."
Obligation:3 "Regulatory Capital and Financial Resources**: Maintain adequate regulatory capital and financial resources as required by the FSRA."
Obligation:4 "Risk Management**: Implement and maintain effective risk management policies and procedures."

Obligation:5 "Compliance Arrangements**: Establish compliance arrangements, including a compliance officer, compliance monitoring program, and if necessary, a money laundering reporting officer (MLRO)."
Obligation:6 "Internal Controls and Governance**: Develop effective internal controls and a sound governance framework with clear organizational structure, roles, and responsibilities."

Obligation:7 "Disclosure and Transparency**: Provide clear, accurate, and transparent information to investors and the regulator, including investment strategies, risks, fees, expenses, and any conflicts of interest."

Obligation:8 "Reporting Obligations**: Fulfill ongoing reporting requirements to the FSRA, including financial reporting, disclosures of significant events, regulatory returns, and any other required information."
Obligation:9 "Client Assets**: Ensure proper safeguarding and segregation of client assets, if applicable."
Obligation:10 "Audit Requirements**: Arrange for annual audits by an independent auditor and submit the reports to the FSRA."
Obligation:11 "Conduct of Business**: Adhere to the ADGM's conduct of business rules, including fair treatment of clients, best execution, and conflict of interest management."
Obligation:12 "Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Counter-Terrorist Financing (CTF)**: Implement AML/CTF systems and controls to prevent, detect, and report suspicious activities."
Obligation:13 "Professional Indemnity Insurance**: Obtain and maintain professional indemnity insurance appropriate to the scale and nature of VC activities."

Obligation:14 "Application Submission**: Submit a complete application for an FSP, including all required forms, supporting documents, and the application fee.

**Note**: It is crucial to review the full guidance document provided by the ADGM FSRA, particularly section 2, and consult with compliance professionals or legal advisors specializing in ADGM financial regulatory compliance to ensure full understanding and adherence to all necessary requirements."

DefinedTerms.Guidance: Has the meaning given in section 15(2) of FSMR.

Passage:
Approved Persons: a VC Manager must appoint a Senior Executive Officer (“SEO”) and, additionally, a Licensed Director (for a Body Corporate) or a Licensed Partner (for a Partnership).  Of the two Approved Persons, the SEO should possess a minimum of ten years’ relevant and demonstrable experience and the Licensed Director or Licensed Partner a minimum of five years’ relevant experience in either:
i.	operating a VC or private equity fund; or
ii.	in-depth industry experience and expertise within the target sectors that the VC Manager intends to focus on investing in .
As per the current requirement for Authorised Persons, the SEO of a VC Manager must be resident in the UAE.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Appoint Key Personnel:**
   - Appoint a Senior Executive Officer (SEO) with at least ten years of relevant experience in operating a VC/private equity fund or with in-depth industry experience in the target sectors.
   - Appoint a Licensed Director (for a Body Corporate) or a Licensed Partner (for a Partnership) with at least five years of relevant experience."

Obligation:2 "Ensure Residency of SEO:**
   - Ensure the SEO is a legal resident of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and is physically present in the UAE."

Obligation:3 "Compliance with ADGM Regulations:**
   - Ensure that the SEO, Licensed Director, or Licensed Partner comply with all ADGM regulations, including fit and proper criteria, ongoing obligations, reporting requirements, and any other rules set by the FSRA."

Obligation:4 "Seek FSRA Approval:**
   - Obtain approval from the FSRA for the appointment of the SEO, Licensed Director, or Licensed Partner before they assume their roles.
   - Notify the FSRA of any changes that might affect the suitability or qualifications of the Approved Persons."

Obligation:5 "Maintain Records:**
   - Keep detailed records of the qualifications, experience, and other relevant information of the Approved Persons to demonstrate regulatory compliance."

Obligation:6 "Monitor Ongoing Compliance:**
   - Continuously assess the fitness and propriety of the Approved Persons to ensure they meet the experience requirements and remain compliant with the ADGM's regulatory framework.
   - Provide ongoing training and support to the Approved Persons to maintain their competence and understanding of the regulatory environment."

Obligation:7 "Stay Informed on Regulatory Changes:**
   - Regularly update your knowledge of the ADGM regulations and guidelines to ensure full compliance and avoid regulatory actions such as fines or revocation of the VC Manager's license."

NamedEntities.equity fund: A fund which invests in at least 85% shares.
NamedEntities.executive: person appointed and given the responsibility to manage the affairs of an organization and the authority to make decisions within specified role-specific boundaries
NamedEntities.private equity fund: investment fund used for making investments in various equity (and to a lesser extent debt) securities according to an investment strategy associated with private equity

DefinedTerms.Body Corporate: Means any body corporate, including limited liability partnership and a body corporate constituted under the law of a country or territory outside of the ADGM.
DefinedTerms.Director:
In relation to:
(a)	GEN, means:
(i)	in relation to an undertaking established under the Companies Regulations 2015, a Person who appears on the register maintained by the ADGM Registration Bureau pursuant to section 153 of those Regulations; and
(ii)	in relation to all other undertakings, a Person who has been admitted to a register which has a corresponding meaning to the ADGM register of Directors or performs the function of acting in the capacity of a Director, by whatever name called;
(b)	MKT, includes, in relation to a Body Corporate:
(i)	a person occupying in relation to it the position of a director (by whatever name called); and
(ii)	a person in accordance with whose directions or instructions (not being advice given in a professional capacity) the directors of that body are accustomed to act; and
(c)	AML, means:
(i)	In relation to an undertaking established under the ADGM Companies Regulations 2015, a Person who appears on the Register of Directors maintained by the ADGM Registrar of Companies; and
(ii)	In relation to all other undertakings, a Person who has been admitted to a register which has a corresponding meaning to the Register of Directors or performs the function of acting in the capacity of a Director, by whatever name called;
(iii)	who is employed or appointed by a Person in connection with that Person's business, whether under a contract of service or for services or otherwise; or
(iv)	whose services, under an arrangement between that Person and a third party, are placed at the disposal and under the control of that Person.
DefinedTerms.Licensed Director: Means the Controlled Function described in GEN 5.3.3.
DefinedTerms.Licensed Partner: Means the Controlled Function described in GEN 5.3.4.
DefinedTerms.Officer:
Means:
(a)	in relation to a limited liability partnership, a member of the limited liability partnership; and
(b)	in relation to a Body Corporate:
(i)	a Director, member of the committee of management, Chief Executive, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body, or a person purporting to act in any such capacity; and
(ii)	an individual who is a Controller of the body.
DefinedTerms.Partner: Means, in relation to an Undertaking which is a Partnership, a Person occupying the position of a partner, by whatever name called.
DefinedTerms.Partnership: Means any partnership, including a partnership constituted under the law of a country, jurisdiction or territory outside the ADGM, but not including a Limited Liability Partnership.
DefinedTerms.Senior Executive Officer: Means, in relation to an Authorised Person, the Controlled Function described in GEN 5.3.2.

Passage: Approved Persons: it will not be mandatory for a VC Manager to appoint a Finance Officer under Rule 5.4.1 of GEN, although the VC Manager should demonstrate that it has the relevant expertise (whether in-house or outsourced) on hand to prepare and oversee its financial accounts.  A VC Manager must, however, appoint a Compliance Officer (“CO”) and a Money Laundering Reporting Officer (“MLRO”) who are independent of the front office investment function, but both functions may be carried out by the same individual, be done in-house or outsourced, and need not be dedicated to, or independent of, other control functions.  The SEO and Directors / Partners of the VC Manager ultimately remain responsible for all compliance matters of the firm.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Ensure Financial Expertise**:
   - Confirm that the firm has the necessary expertise to manage financial accounts. This can be achieved through either in-house capabilities or by outsourcing the function."

Obligation:2 "Appoint a Compliance Officer (CO)**:
   - Appoint a Compliance Officer who is responsible for ensuring that the firm complies with the regulatory framework and internal policies. The CO must maintain independence from the front office investment function."

Obligation:3 "Appoint a Money Laundering Reporting Officer (MLRO)**:
   - Appoint a Money Laundering Reporting Officer who is in charge of overseeing the firm's anti-money laundering policies and procedures and reporting suspicious activities. The MLRO should also be independent of the front office investment function."

Obligation:4 "Consider Dual Role for CO and MLRO**:
   - Evaluate whether the roles of CO and MLRO can be combined and performed by the same individual, based on the firm's size and risk profile. This decision should take into account the need for independence from the investment function."

Obligation:5 "Determine Role Structure**:
   - Decide whether the CO and MLRO roles will be filled in-house or outsourced. Ensure that these roles are not necessarily dedicated solely to these functions and that they can be integrated with other control functions within the firm, except for the front office investment function."

Obligation:6 "Maintain Ultimate Responsibility**:
   - As the Senior Executive Officer (SEO) and Directors/Partners, maintain ultimate responsibility for the firm's compliance with all regulatory matters. Ensure that the firm adheres to all regulatory requirements and that the appointed CO and MLRO effectively carry out their responsibilities.

By adhering to these action items, the VC Manager will ensure regulatory compliance within the ADGM framework and mitigate the risk of regulatory sanctions or penalties."

NamedEntities.control: situation in which some party has the power to direct or strongly influence the direction of the management and policies related to something

DefinedTerms.Compliance Officer: Means in relation to an Authorised Person, the Controlled Function described in GEN 5.3.6.
DefinedTerms.Finance Officer: Means in relation to an Authorised Person, the Controlled Function described in GEN 5.3.5.
DefinedTerms.GEN: Means the General module of the Rulebook.
DefinedTerms.Money: Means any form of money, including banknotes, coins, cheques, Electronic Money and any other non-cash form, such as payable orders.
DefinedTerms.Money Laundering Reporting Officer: Means, for the purposes of an Authorised Person other than a Credit Rating Agency, the Controlled Function described in GEN 5.3.8.
DefinedTerms.Officer:
Means:
(a)	in relation to a limited liability partnership, a member of the limited liability partnership; and
(b)	in relation to a Body Corporate:
(i)	a Director, member of the committee of management, Chief Executive, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body, or a person purporting to act in any such capacity; and
(ii)	an individual who is a Controller of the body.
DefinedTerms.Rule: Means any rule made by the Regulator or the Board, as applicable, in accordance with the procedures in Part 2 of FSMR.

Passage:
Control Functions: the Regulator will not require a VC Manager to meet the following governance and control requirements.

\Table Start

Requirement	Rule(s)	Note
Internal audit function	GEN 3.3.13	A VC Manager is not required to appoint an internal auditor under GEN Rule 3.1.1(5).
Independent custodian	FUNDS 12.3.7(1)(b) and 12.3.3(4)	A VC Manager does not have to appoint a separate custodian where it can demonstrate to the Regulator that either:
(i) 	an adequate and effective alternative safekeeping mechanism exists; or
(ii)	it would not be practical or proportionate to do so.
Independent valuation	FUNDS 12.3.10	A VC Manager may choose not to establish an independent valuation function, but must demonstrate, to the satisfaction of the Regulator, that there is functional and hierarchical separation and independence between the risk management and the portfolio management functions.
Independent fund administrator	FUNDS 12.3.7(1)(a)	A VC Manager may choose not to appoint an independent fund administrator given the relatively illiquid nature of a VC Fund, arising from its closed-ended nature (with no ongoing subscriptions or redemptions).
\Table End

A VC Manager will have to disclose to its clients that it is not mandatory for it to comply with the above control requirements. However, investors in the fund may still negotiate the inclusion of these safeguards as part of their contractual agreements with the VC Manager.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Disclose Regulatory Exemptions to Clients**:
   - Clearly inform clients about the specific governance and control requirements that you are not mandated to comply with."

Obligation:2 "Implement Alternative Safeguarding Mechanisms**:
   - If not appointing an independent custodian, demonstrate to the Regulator the existence of an adequate and effective alternative safekeeping mechanism or justify why appointing a custodian is impractical or disproportionate."

Obligation:3 "Ensure Functional and Hierarchical Separation**:
   - If opting out of an independent valuation function, ensure and demonstrate functional and hierarchical separation between risk management and portfolio management to mitigate conflicts of interest."

Obligation:4 "Negotiate Contractual Safeguards with Investors**:
   - Be prepared to discuss and potentially include additional safeguards in contractual agreements with investors, as requested."

Obligation:5 "Comply with All Other Applicable ADGM Rules**:
   - Adhere to all other relevant rules and regulations set by the ADGM FSRA that are not explicitly exempted."

Obligation:6 "Engage with the Regulator**:
   - Maintain open and proactive communication with the Regulator, particularly when implementing alternative mechanisms or demonstrating compliance with required separations."

Obligation:7 "Maintain Adequate Record-Keeping**:
   - Keep thorough records of all client disclosures and any investor agreements regarding the inclusion of non-mandatory safeguards."

Obligation:8 "Implement Robust Risk Management Practices**:
   - Develop and maintain strong risk management practices appropriate to the nature, scale, and complexity of your activities, regardless of the exemption from having an independent risk management function."

Obligation:9 "Monitor Internal Controls and Risk Management**:
   - Even though an internal audit function is not required, ensure that other mechanisms are in place to monitor and assess the effectiveness of internal controls and risk management processes."

Obligation:10 "Ensure Proper Fund Administration**:
    - If not appointing an independent fund administrator, have processes in place to ensure the proper administration of the fund.

By following these action items, you will meet the regulatory expectations of the ADGM while leveraging the flexibility provided to VC Managers in certain governance and control functions. Regularly review the ADGM's regulatory framework for updates or changes to your obligations."

NamedEntities.fund administrator: Entity that has to fulfil the legal and supervisory requirements of the fund. Responsible for all the business purposes around the investment pool, and so is reponsible for the issuing of the shares.
NamedEntities.control: situation in which some party has the power to direct or strongly influence the direction of the management and policies related to something
NamedEntities.funds: artificial currency used as calculation basis for another currency(s) and accounting purposes
NamedEntities.custodian: financial institution that holds customers' securities for safekeeping
NamedEntities.auditor: party qualified and authorized to review and verify the accuracy of financial records and ensure that companies comply with tax laws

DefinedTerms.GEN: Means the General module of the Rulebook.
DefinedTerms.Regulator: Means the Financial Services Regulatory Authority.
DefinedTerms.Rule: Means any rule made by the Regulator or the Board, as applicable, in accordance with the procedures in Part 2 of FSMR.

Passage:
Capital Requirements:  a VC Manager will not be required to maintain the Base Capital Requirement or the Expenditure Based Capital Minimum on an on-going basis as set out in Chapter 3 of PRU for investment business.  The VC Manager will, however, have to disclose to its clients that it is exempted from those capital requirements. Additionally, the VC Manager will still be required to:
i.	submit audited financial statements and audit reports annually (as applicable) pursuant to GEN Rule 6.6;
ii.	demonstrate the ability to meet its liabilities as they fall due and to have adequate financial resources to manage its affairs prudently and soundly, pursuant to GEN Rules 2.2.4 and 5.2.8; and
iii.	ensure that the VC Funds it managers are subject to annual audit requirements pursuant to Chapter 16 of FUNDS.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Disclosure to Clients**:
   - Inform clients about the exemption from the Base Capital Requirement and the Expenditure Based Capital Minimum to maintain transparency."

Obligation:2 "Submission of Audited Financial Statements and Audit Reports**:
   - Submit audited financial statements and audit reports annually as per GEN Rule 6.6."

Obligation:3 "Financial Resources and Liabilities Management**:
   - Ensure sufficient liquidity to meet short-term liabilities as they fall due.
   - Maintain adequate financial resources for prudent and sound management of affairs in accordance with GEN Rules 2.2.4 and 5.2.8."

Obligation:4 "Annual Audit Requirements for VC Funds**:
   - Guarantee that VC Funds managed are audited annually in line with the requirements of Chapter 16 of the FUNDS rules."

Obligation:5 "Establishment of Internal Policies and Procedures**:
   - Develop and implement internal policies and procedures to consistently meet the regulatory requirements.
   - Set up proper accounting practices and maintain adequate financial records.
   - Engage with qualified auditors for the preparation of financial statements and audit reports.
   - Implement a risk management framework to manage financial resources and liabilities effectively."

Obligation:6 "Ongoing Compliance and Advisory Consultation**:
   - Stay updated on changes to the ADGM's regulatory framework.
   - Regularly consult with legal and financial advisors familiar with ADGM regulations to ensure ongoing compliance."

Obligation:7 "Risk Management**:
   - Although not explicitly listed as a separate action item, it is implied that a risk management framework should be in place as part of managing financial resources and liabilities. This should be considered when establishing internal policies and procedures."

NamedEntities.funds: artificial currency used as calculation basis for another currency(s) and accounting purposes

DefinedTerms.Capital: Means Tier 1 Capital, as defined in PRU.
DefinedTerms.Capital Requirement: Means the minimum amount of Capital Resources an Authorised Person must hold, calculated in accordance with the applicable provisions of PRU Chapter 3.
DefinedTerms.Expenditure Based Capital Minimum: Means a capital requirement calculated in accordance with PRU 3.7.
DefinedTerms.GEN: Means the General module of the Rulebook.
DefinedTerms.Rule: Means any rule made by the Regulator or the Board, as applicable, in accordance with the procedures in Part 2 of FSMR.

Passage: Professional Indemnity Insurance [“PII”]: as set out in Rule 6.12 of PRU, a VC Manager shall maintain PII cover appropriate to the nature, size and risk profile of its business.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Assess and Maintain Appropriate Coverage**: Evaluate and ensure that the PII coverage is suitable for the nature, size, and risk profile of your business activities."
Obligation:2 "Comply with Regulatory Requirements**: Adhere to the ADGM FSRA's minimum requirements for PII coverage, including terms, conditions, and limits."
Obligation:3 "Ensure Continuous Coverage**: Maintain uninterrupted PII coverage at all times during operation, with no gaps."
Obligation:4 "Review and Adjust Policy as Needed**: Regularly review the PII policy terms and conditions, and make adjustments in response to significant changes in your business."
Obligation:5 "Notify Insurer of Business Changes**: Inform your insurance provider of any significant changes to your business that could affect the PII coverage."
Obligation:6 "Fulfill Regulatory Reporting Obligations**: Provide evidence of PII coverage to the FSRA as required for regular reporting or upon request."
Obligation:7 "Conduct Due Diligence on Insurers**: Perform due diligence to ensure the chosen insurance provider is reputable and capable of fulfilling claims."
Obligation:8 "Implement Risk Management Practices**: Establish and maintain a risk management framework to minimize the likelihood of claims."
Obligation:9 "Maintain Records**: Keep detailed records of your PII policy, correspondence, claims, and notifications as per ADGM regulations."
Obligation:10 "Stay Informed of Regulatory Changes**: Keep up-to-date with any updates or changes to the regulatory framework and adjust your PII coverage accordingly."
Obligation:11 "Seek Professional Advice if Necessary**: Consult the PRU rulebook and seek professional advice to ensure full compliance with the regulatory requirements."

DefinedTerms.Rule: Means any rule made by the Regulator or the Board, as applicable, in accordance with the procedures in Part 2 of FSMR.

Passage:
SUMMARY OF REQUIREMENTS FOR CONTROLLED FUNCTIONS (“KEY OFFICERS”)
The minimum evaluation criteria in respect of the competency of the Key Officers and compliance arrangements of the VC Manager are summarised in the table below.

\Table Start
Evaluation Criteria	Requirement(s)
(a)	Number of Approved Persons:
Approved Persons (as set out in GEN 5.3) will include the Licensed Directors, Licensed Partners and Senior Executive Officer (“SEO”) of the VC Manager. Nominee directors such as legal advisers or corporate secretaries will not count towards meeting this requirement.	At least two
Of these Approved Persons:

(i)	Minimum years of individual relevant experience 	SEO – ten years
Others – five years
(ii)	Number resident in the U.A.E.	At least one,
including the SEO
(b)	Number of employees/professionals conducting the regulated activities residing in the U.A.E:
Such employees/professionals may include the Approved Persons (as set out in GEN 5.3) of the VC Manager.	At least two
(c)	Compliance Function
The VC Manager may, depending on the scale, nature and complexity of its operations:
(i)	have a compliance function with staff who are suitably qualified  and independent from the front office;
(ii)	rely on compliance oversight and support from an independent compliance team at its holding company or related entity; or
(iii)	engage an external service provider to support its compliance arrangements. The VC Manager should ensure that the service provider is competent and familiar with the regulatory requirements for VC Managers in ADGM. The service provider should be able to provide meaningful onsite presence at the VC Manager.
\Table End

NamedEntities.executive: person appointed and given the responsibility to manage the affairs of an organization and the authority to make decisions within specified role-specific boundaries
NamedEntities.holding: real or personal property (assets), including but not limited to financial assets, to which one holds title and of which one has possession
NamedEntities.holding company: business entity established to own stock in another company, typically to own enough voting shares to have some level of control over that company's policies and management

DefinedTerms.ADGM: Means the Abu Dhabi Global Market.
DefinedTerms.GEN: Means the General module of the Rulebook.
DefinedTerms.Officer:
Means:
(a)	in relation to a limited liability partnership, a member of the limited liability partnership; and
(b)	in relation to a Body Corporate:
(i)	a Director, member of the committee of management, Chief Executive, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body, or a person purporting to act in any such capacity; and
(ii)	an individual who is a Controller of the body.
DefinedTerms.Senior Executive Officer: Means, in relation to an Authorised Person, the Controlled Function described in GEN 5.3.2.
